thread.title: Home show at Waco’s Magnolia Market
thread.title_full: Home show at Waco’s Magnolia Market | Dallas Morning News

author: dallasnews
title: Home show at Waco’s Magnolia Market
text:
WACO Fans of ‘Fixer Upper’ can scoop up a piece of the home show Fans of the HGTV show Fixer Upper will want to trek to Waco for the first Magnolia Market Home Show. Shoppers will be able to sift through items from the store owned by the stars of the show, Chip and Joanna Gaines.
Expect to find goods in the pair’s signature “fresh country” style, plus the event promises “tents full of staging items used in Fixer Upper. ” Get a peek behind the scenes and grab some treasures Sept. 4-5.
The event will also include extended store hours, food trucks, games and other activities.
Tip: Bring a trailer as there will be lots of large items for sale.
Contact: magnoliahomes.net ; 254-235-0603
ABILENE West Texas Rodeo offers fun for the whole family Put on your cowboy boots and get ready for an old-fashioned good time when you visit the 116th annual West Texas Fair & Rodeo.
The event, Sept. 10-19, will include livestock and horse shows, carnival games and rides.
Don’t miss the tractor pulls and parade Sept. 12 in downtown Abilene.
The fairgrounds are on State Highway 36 and Loop 322, 3 miles from downtown Abilene.
Contact: taylorcountyexpocenter.com/events/west-texas-fair-rode o; 325-677-4376
ANGEL FIRE, N.M. Visitors can enjoy bikes, brews and blues at annual festival Angel Fire Resort is offering three days of high-energy excitement at its annual Gravity Games and Bikes, Blues and Brews Festival.
The event runs Sept. 4-6 and includes music, a mountainside fest with New Mexico’s top brewers, motorcycle riding and three days of mountain-biking competition.
Tickets are available on-site. Admission to the Gravity Games is $50 for adults, $40 for ages 11 and younger. Bikes, Blues and Brews Festival tickets are $20, which includes beer sampling, a commemorative glass, live music and one pint of beer.
Contact: angelfireresort.com ; 1-800-633-7463
BRECKENRIDGE, COLO. Celebrate Germany at Oktoberfest in the Rockies Enjoy a taste of Germany in the Rocky Mountains this fall. Breckenridge, Colo., is hosting its 21st annual Oktoberfest Sept. 11-13.
The festival will feature food and brew vendors, dancing, music and numerous family-friendly activities. Drinkers can sample a variety of brews — everything from local Breckenridge Brewery to Paulaner, which is one of the six breweries at the Munich festival.
Traveler’s tip: This is the perfect time to take advantage of fall foliage, so work in some sightseeing around town.
Condos during the event start at $127 per night, with options to add dinner or beer stein packages.
Contact: 1-888-251-2417; book.gobreck.com or gobreck.com/events/breckenridge-oktoberfest
